post.body: Recycing kids toys is a great idea, there are just so many of them and they grow out of them so quickly. JJ
Companies in India moving towards low carbon economy WWF India reports. http://cli.gs/2UGb3g - CC
Sorry to all our supporters but the Earth Hour web site has been temp down for part of 2day and should be back on line soon cheers CC
WWF China press release - Beijing and Shangai will go dark for Earth Hour. Great work team http://cli.gs/s1XY1z - CC
How green is Ireland? Greenest. Check out new Eco-bus trips http://cli.gs/2ZzGqH - CC
6 cities have signed up for Earth Hour in the Middle East. Congratulations on a huge effort from WWF Climate Team http://cli.gs/WqZ3LR - CC
WWF applauds British call for ship emission trading http://cli.gs/VT34ZN - CC
IBM and other big tech companies rating high on climate change governance http://cli.gs/Mh7hA3 - CC
WWF Hong Kong reports that over 140 companies have signed up to Earth Hour - congratulations Panda team http://cli.gs/44Ye30 - CC
WWF reports 1000 new plants & animals found in Great Mekong region. Protect them we could also stop climate change http://cli.gs/tHUZ07 - CC
Well thank might be enough links for now. There will be so much going on (or off) all over the world for Earth Hour! :) JJ
Nashville. Great to see: Mayor urges lights out for climate event. The Tennessean http://tinyurl.com/57c5qo JJ
We're happy to have Canada with us too :) Earth Hour '09 to send message. Toronto Star: http://www.thestar.com/News/GTA/article/552021 JJ
Here's the Sydney Morning Herald's post on Earth Hour last week. Sydney is where it all started: http://tinyurl.com/6m6p3h JJ
Great to see that four emirates have committed to 2009 Earth Hour http://www.gulfnews.com/nation/Environment/10267274.html
For the first time, Vietnam joins Earth Hour campaign: http://english.vietnamnet.vn/social/2008/12/818310/ JJ
800th+ follower mark. Thanks to all. Feel free to help spread the word about Earth Hour further. Together we can make a difference :) JJ
